verses.verse: My <S%H5315>soul<s%> is <S%H5354>weary<s%> of my <S%H2416>life;<s%> I will <S%H5800>leave<s%> my <S%H7879>complaint<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> myself; I will <S%H1696>speak<s%> in the <S%H4751>bitterness<s%> of my <S%H5315>soul.<s%>
I will <S%H559>say<s%> <S%H413>unto<s%> <S%H433>God,<s%> Do <S%H408>not<s%> <S%H7561>condemn<s%> me; <S%H3045>show<s%> me <S%H5921>wherefore<s%> <S%H4100><s%> thou <S%H7378>contendest<s%> with me.

Is it <S%H2896>good<s%> unto thee <S%H3588>that<s%> thou shouldest <S%H6231>oppress,<s%> <S%H3588>that<s%> thou shouldest <S%H3988>despise<s%> the <S%H3018>work<s%> of thine <S%H3709>hands,<s%> and <S%H3313>shine<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> the <S%H6098>counsel<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked?<s%>
Hast thou <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of <S%H1320>flesh?<s%> <S%H518>or<s%> <S%H7200>seest<s%> thou as <S%H582>man<s%> <S%H7200>seeth?<s%>
Are thy <S%H3117>days<s%> as the <S%H3117>days<s%> of <S%H582>man?<s%> are thy <S%H8141>years<s%> as <S%H1397>man's<s%> <S%H3117>days,<s%>
That <S%H3588><s%> thou <S%H1245>inquirest<s%> after mine <S%H5771>iniquity,<s%> and <S%H1875>searchest<s%> after my <S%H2403>sin?<s%>
Thou <S%H1847>knowest<s%> <S%H3588>that<s%> I am <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H7561>wicked;<s%> and there is <S%H369>none<s%> that can <S%H5337>deliver<s%> out of thine <S%H4480>hand.<s%> <S%H3027><s%>
Thine <S%H3027>hands<s%> have <S%H6087>made<s%> me and <S%H6213>fashioned<s%> me <S%H3162>together<s%> round <S%H5439>about;<s%> yet thou dost <S%H1104>destroy<s%> me.

Remember, <S%H2142><s%> I beseech <S%H4994>thee,<s%> <S%H3588>that<s%> thou hast <S%H6213>made<s%> me as the <S%H2563>clay;<s%> and wilt thou bring me into dust <S%H7725>again?<s%> <S%H413><s%> <S%H6083><s%>
Hast thou <S%H3808>not<s%> poured me <S%H5413>out<s%> as <S%H2461>milk,<s%> and <S%H7087>curdled<s%> me like <S%H1385>cheese?<s%>
Thou hast <S%H3847>clothed<s%> me with <S%H5785>skin<s%> and <S%H1320>flesh,<s%> and hast <S%H7753>fenced<s%> me with <S%H6106>bones<s%> and <S%H1517>sinews.<s%>
Thou hast <S%H6213>granted<s%> <S%H5978><s%> me <S%H2416>life<s%> and <S%H2617>favor,<s%> and thy <S%H6486>visitation<s%> hath <S%H8104>preserved<s%> my <S%H7307>spirit.<s%>
And <S%H428>these<s%> things hast thou <S%H6845>hid<s%> in thine <S%H3824>heart:<s%> I <S%H3045>know<s%> <S%H3588>that<s%> <S%H2063>this<s%> is <S%H5973>with<s%> thee.
If <S%H518><s%> I <S%H2398>sin,<s%> then thou <S%H8104>markest<s%> me, and thou wilt <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H5352>acquit<s%> me from mine <S%H4480>iniquity.<s%> <S%H5771><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I be <S%H7561>wicked,<s%> <S%H480>woe<s%> unto me; and if I be <S%H6663>righteous,<s%> yet will I <S%H3808>not<s%> lift <S%H5375>up<s%> my <S%H7218>head.<s%> I am <S%H7649>full<s%> of <S%H7036>confusion;<s%> therefore <S%H7200>see<s%> thou mine <S%H6040>affliction;<s%>
For it <S%H1342>increaseth.<s%> Thou <S%H6679>huntest<s%> me as a fierce <S%H7826>lion:<s%> and <S%H7725>again<s%> thou showest thyself <S%H6381>marvelous<s%> upon me.

Thou <S%H2318>renewest<s%> thy <S%H5707>witnesses<s%> <S%H5048>against<s%> me, and <S%H7235>increasest<s%> thine <S%H3708>indignation<s%> <S%H5973>upon<s%> me; <S%H2487>changes<s%> and <S%H6635>war<s%> are <S%H5973>against<s%> me.

Wherefore <S%H4100><s%> then hast thou brought me <S%H3318>forth<s%> out of the <S%H4480>womb?<s%> <S%H7358><s%> Oh that I had given up the <S%H1478>ghost,<s%> and <S%H3808>no<s%> <S%H5869>eye<s%> had <S%H7200>seen<s%> me!

I should have <S%H1961>been<s%> as <S%H834>though<s%> I had <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H1961>been;<s%> I should have been <S%H2986>carried<s%> from the <S%H4480>womb<s%> <S%H990><s%> to the <S%H6913>grave.<s%>
Are <S%H3808>not<s%> my <S%H3117>days<s%> <S%H4592>few?<s%> <S%H2308>cease<s%> then, and let me <S%H7896>alone,<s%> <S%H4480><s%> that I may take <S%H1082>comfort<s%> a <S%H4592>little,<s%>
Before <S%H2962><s%> I <S%H1980>go<s%> whence I shall <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H7725>return,<s%> even <S%H413>to<s%> the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H2822>darkness<s%> and the shadow of <S%H6757>death;<s%>

A <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H5890>darkness,<s%> <S%H3644>as<s%> <S%H652>darkness<s%> itself; and of the shadow of <S%H6757>death,<s%> <S%H3808>without<s%> any <S%H5468>order,<s%> and where the <S%H3313>light<s%> is <S%H3644>as<s%> <S%H652>darkness.<s%>
